meanings.definition: Not having sufficient proof or evidence.
meanings.sent1: The underproof claim was dismissed due to lack of evidence.
meanings.sent2: The detective knew the case was underproof without any solid evidence.
meanings.sent3: The underproof alibi fell apart under scrutiny.
meanings.sent4: Her underproof argument crumbled when challenged.
meanings.sent5: The underproof theory failed to convince anyone.

meanings.definition: Below the required standard or level of quality.
meanings.sent1: The underproof cake was dry and tasteless.
meanings.sent2: The underproof product did not meet customer expectations.
meanings.sent3: The underproof performance left the audience disappointed.
meanings.sent4: Her underproof painting lacked depth and detail.
meanings.sent5: The underproof construction was evident in the shaky foundation.
